item.title: Publications
item.description: A current list of publications involving Thibault Randrianarisoa.

item.title: Your Inner Hedgehog
item.description: This paper describes the inner hedgehog, a psychological condition widespread in academia. Published in the Journal of Socio-Experimental Psychology, 2021.

item.title: List of Irregular Verbs Across Romance Languages
item.description: This dataset contains all irregular verbs in known Romance languages.

item.title: Unusual Uses For Olive Oil
item.description: This paper reviews unusual uses for olive oil throughout the Mediterranean world. Published in the Journal of Oleic Science, 2013.

item.title: The Finer Points of Sausage Dogs
item.description: This paper studies the pulmonary efficiency of sausage dogs. Published in the Journal of Canine Science, 2004.

item.title: Lectures at the Villa of Reduced Circumstances
item.description: This graduate course presents classical results in Romance philology.

item.title: Portugese Irregular Verbs
item.description: This book discusses Portugese irregular verbs in great details.

item.title: Profanity in Early Irish
item.description: This undergraduate course discusses profanity in Early Irish.

Research interests

I am mainly interested in high-dimensional and nonparametric statistics. More precisely, my research interests include statistical machine learning, Bayesian nonparametrics, uncertainty quantification and inverse problems.

Topics I have worked on include:

  • Bayesian nonparametrics
  • (Deep) Gaussian processes
  • Tree-based methods (Random Forests, CART, Pólya Trees, BART,…)
  • Uncertainty quantification
  • Variational Bayes
  • Inverse problems
  • Differential privacy

Short Biography

I am a Postdoctoral Fellow in the Department of Computer & Mathematical Sciences at the University of Toronto at Scarborough (UTSC), working with Dan Roy. I completed my PhD in Statistics at Sorbonne Université (Paris, France), where I worked in the LPSM lab under the supervision of Ismaël Castillo. Before joining the UoT, I was a Postdoctoral researcher at BIDSA, Bocconi University (Milan, Italy) working with Botond Szabo.

My PhD manuscript can be found here.
